newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka stocks end sharply up on wide buying.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka stocks end sharply up on wide buying.

text.p: Sri Lanka stocks closed sharply higher on Thursday for the second successive session, as demand outpaced supply, brokers said.
The all share index closed 10.1 points up at 773.6. Ceylon Cold Stores was nine rupees up at 150, Ceylon Brewery 3.75 at 79.75, Grain Elevators 1.50 to 25.50.

"There is more demand than supply. But the situation is likely to change, because with every point the index rises, sellers seem more willing to give stock," said Sabri Marikar of John Keells Stock Brokers.
Turnover was 91 million rupees, with foreign buying accounting for 26.4 million rupees and selling, 11.1 million.
Colombo stocks, which broke the psychological 750-point barrier on Wednesday after 22 months, are seen rising steadily on the back of good growth expectations, analysts said.
"There is still more room for the index to rise," said Gihan Rajapakse of CTC Eale Fund Management.
"The market is reacting to fundamentals as you can clearly see from the way shares of companies which are expected to see good growth in 1997, are rising," he added.
Analysts say the all share is likely to rise above 800 points by August.
